section: The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: This section creates a contradiction. It states that the agreement can be renewed by mutual written agreement but then adds that if neither party gives notice of non-renewal 30 days before expiration, the agreement is automatically renewed. This contradicts the requirement for mutual written agreement because it allows for automatic renewal without explicit agreement.

section: Each party (the "Guarantor") shall protect the other party (the "Protected Party") from any and all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, specifically including legal counsel payments, that the Protected Party accrues due to external grievances resulting from the Guarantor's actions, failures, or deceptive statements, provided the Protected Party is considered a key agent of the Guarantor. Furthermore, 2TheMart will protect i-Escrow from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, inclusive of justifiable legal costs, that i-Escrow bears due to external grievances derived from 2TheMart Material. Additionally, i-Escrow will protect 2TheMart from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, including justified attorney costs, that 2TheMart bears due to external grievances arising from i-Escrow Media and/or the Deliverables provided to Patrons.
explanation: The initial sentence states that the Protected Party must be considered a key agent of the Guarantor for indemnification to apply. However, the subsequent sentences provide specific indemnification obligations without mentioning the key agent requirement. This creates a misalignment, as it's unclear whether the key agent requirement applies to all indemnification obligations or only to the general statement in the first sentence.

section: This Agreement will be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California without giving effect to conflict of laws principles. Both parties submit to personal jurisdiction in California and further agree that any cause of action arising under this Agreement shall be brought in a court in Orange County, California.
explanation: While specifying Orange County, California as the venue provides certainty, it might conflict with California law regarding proper venue. Depending on the nature of the dispute (e.g., contract dispute related to real property located elsewhere), California law might mandate a different venue. This section could potentially be unenforceable to the extent it conflicts with mandatory venue provisions under California law.
